ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I give care because: It is my duty to provide care to elderly dependent family members.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I give care because: It is important to set an example for the children in the family.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I give care because: I was taught by my parents to take care of elderly dependent family members.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I give care because: Of my religious and spiritual beliefs.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I give care because: By giving care to elderly dependent family members, I am giving back what has been given to me.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I give care because: It strengthens the bonds between me and them.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I give care because: I was raised to believe care should be provided in the family.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I give care because: It is what my people have always done.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I give care because: I feel as though I am being useful and making a family contribution. j. My family expects me to provide care.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I give care because: My family expects me to provide care.
Notes: 4 = strongly agree; 3 = somewhat agree; 2 = somewhat disagree; 1 = strongly disagree

ElementDescription: Cultural Justification for Caregiving Scale (CJCS) - Total Score
Notes: Items are summed, and scores may range from 10 to 40, with higher scores indicating stronger cultural reasons for giving care.
